intro: Phanera crudiantha, commonly known as the rough phanera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive red calyx. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
